section.label: overview-batch
section.title: Spring Batch
section.para: Spring Batch is an Apache 2.0 open source project that enables large organizations to develop customized enterprise batch applications essential to their daily operations. It provides out of the box handling of common batch scenarios such as automatic retries after failure, periodic commits synchronous and asynchronous processing, non-sequential processing, job tracking, and restart. It also contains several components for parsing, mapping, reading and writing data to and from various traditional data sources, for example flat files, relational databases, and messaging systems as well as an admin console and associated web application. It used in production in many mission critical environments across a range of industriers.

Spring Batch It is developed by SpringSource in collaboration with Accenture. The first 1.0 release was made in 2007 and is now at version 2.2.x. It has been designed with extensibility in mind. The Spring Hadoop hooks into those extensibility points so that in addition to interacting with traditional data sources in an enterprise batch job, Spring Batch jobs can now interact with a wide range of Hadoop projects, from HDFS and map-reduce, to Hive, Pig, and HBase.
To learn more about Spring Batch, visit the Spring Batch project page. There are also two books available.
